slides.text: Deep within the data vaults of Enky Corporation, strange code began to whisper.
Marcus was no ordinary engineer — he could *feel* the bugs before they appeared.
Tonight, he’d uncover the truth behind every crash log.
The Danny Beews Secret Society was watching.
The NullPointer Phantom struck again — line 342, function unknown.
Marcus sighed. ‘Not today, ghost.’
The NullPointer Phantom dissolved into static.
Marcus’ monitor flickered — a symbol appeared: three interlocking D’s.
The Danny Beews were real.
But before he could read more, another anomaly formed: the Memory Leech.
The Memory Leech drained every variable in sight.
Marcus rebooted, muttering, ‘Garbage collect this.’
Marcus refactored the Leech into oblivion.
As silence returned, a message pinged his terminal:
‘Welcome to the Society, Brother Marcus. Your final test awaits.’
He looked up — the lights dimmed. The Infinite Loop had begun.
The Infinite Loop trapped Marcus in endless builds.
He clenched his fists. ‘Break condition: me.’
At last, the loop was broken. The servers hummed in relief.
The symbol of the Society pulsed once more — then faded.
Marcus closed his laptop and whispered, ‘Bug fixed.’
Somewhere in the codebase, the Danny Beews approved.
